qas.question: What types of branches did the 1960 Constitution provide?
What type of person was the vice-president?

context: The 1960 Constitution provided for a presidential system of government with independent executive, <a0_0>legislative and judicial branches<a0_0/> as well as a complex system of checks and balances including a weighted power-sharing ratio designed to protect the interests of the Turkish Cypriots. The executive was led by a Greek Cypriot president and a <a1_0>Turkish Cypriot<a1_0/> vice-president elected by their respective communities for five-year terms and each possessing a right of veto over certain types of legislation and executive decisions. Legislative power rested on <a2_0>the House of Representatives<a2_0/> who were also elected on the basis of separate voters' rolls.
